Authors:
Nicolas Niveiro, Andrea Michlig, Natalia Andrea Ramirez,
Carlos Alberto Salvador-Montoya, Maria Laura Perez, Edgardo Omar
Alberto, Vladimir Antonin
Title:
Two new setose species of Marasmius from the Paraná riparian
forest in Argentina
Keywords:
Agaricales, Basidiomycota, diversity, key, Marasmiaceae,
M. chrysoblepharis, M. trichotus, Sicci, Spinulosi, taxonomy
Abstract:
The aim of this article is to describe two new setose
species of Marasmius: M. chrysoblepharioides and M. neotrichotus from
the riparian forest of the Paraná river in Northeastern Argentina.
Marasmius chrysoblepharioides is characterized by its yellowish orange
pileus, with a sulcate-striate margin, entirely pilose orange brown
stipe, setiform caulocystidia (28.5235 × 613.8 µm) with a tapering and
thick-walled apex and baciliform to fusiform (1519 × 3.54.5 µm) spores.
Marasmius neotrichotus is characterized by the brownish orange pileus
surface with the non-striated margin and close white lamellae, large
setoid cystidia on the pileus (pileocystidia 80370 × 59 µm) and stipe
surface (caulocystidia 40480 × 515 µm), the absence of broom cells in
the stipitipellis and the cylindrical to baciliform spores (915 × 3.55
µm in size). The phylogenetic analyses based on molecular data from
nrITS sequences shown that two species are different from other
Marasmius species of the ser. Spinulosi.
